comments.body: If you open an issue upstream link it to a feedstock issue so we can track this and remove the patch.

Turns out this was already fixed in the original repo but not yet merged into a new version for pypi - see [issue 99](https://github.com/aerkalov/ebooklib/issues/99) and [issue 104.](https://github.com/aerkalov/ebooklib/issues/104)

We could also apply a patch based on commit ( https://github.com/aerkalov/ebooklib/commit/c179d7ad325639424dc19194df2e41753793d250 ). Though that, of course, would be done in the feedstock at this point.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +8,12 @@     description = 'Ebook library which can handle EPUB2/EPUB3 and Kindle format',
-    long_description = open('README.md').read(),
+    long_description = 'Windows and py3k had trouble with ingesting README.md here. See README.md directly',
     keywords = ['ebook', 'epub', 'kindle'],
     classifiers = [
